page.title: 07Gellidochliethe.
page.content: The main building structure dates back to the fifteenth century, a period when{Gellidochliethe}was one of the stately homes of Wales and offered shelter to monks during Thomas Cromwell's oppression of the Catholic church. During the Elizabethan period there were two chapels at Henllan Uchaf and Henllan Isaf. The latter was farmed by the Cistercian monks from Neath Abbey. {Gellidochliethe}is now a 580 acre working farm and hosts a successful business trading in{'Welsh Farmhouse {Holidays'.}The house was visited by the Select Committee of the 'Department of Trade and Industry' during their tour of Wales between February 5th-7th 1985.
